snippet: The United Nations Human Rights Council passed a nonbinding resolution that supports Internet freedom, leaving Internet companies to decide how much to collaborate with government authorities in the tracking of citizens.
abstract: The United Nations Human Rights Council passed a nonbinding resolution that supports Internet freedom, leaving Internet companies to decide how much to collaborate with government authorities in the tracking of citizens.

headline.main: U.N. Affirms Internet Freedom as a Basic Right

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
